roleset.name: get
roleset.note: SECURE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'secure' based on financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. Member of Vncls get-13.5.1-1. (from secure.01-v)

example.name: secure-v: typically passive
example.text: Financing plans include raising $170 million in debt-1 secured *trace*-1 by the company's holdings in New Jersey.
example.arg: by the company 's holdings in New Jersey

example.name: secure-v: with source
example.text: McCaw said it has secured commitments from three banks to help finance its $125-a-share bid for 22 million of Lin's shares.
example.arg: [ commitments ] [ to help finance its $125-a-share bid for 22 million of Lin's shares]

roleset.name: make secure, literally or figuratively
roleset.note: SECURE-V NOTES: Adjectival 'secure' based on BOLT-2,3. Member of VNcls ensure-99, shake-22.3-2-1. (from secure.02-v)

example.name: secure-v: poor John
example.note: In this interpretation, John already had a place in the Hall of Shame. His lousy dissertation just made that placement secure.
example.text: John secured his place in the Hall of Shame with his lousy dissertation.
example.arg: his place in the Hall of Shame

roleset.name: be safe, secure
roleset.note: SECURITY-N NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.
SECURE-J NOTES: Automatically created as an alias file for unification. (from secure.02-j)

role.descr: specific domain in which arg1 is safe

example.name: security-n
example.text: The economic security of families is crucial to creating the optimal conditions through which children can develop, learn and grow.

example.name: security-n
example.text: In this work, we propose a novel application of a key-based obfuscation technique to achieve security against hardware Trojans.

example.name: secure-j
example.text: You would think that having 4 part time jobs that at least you will have 2 at any one time and that is more secure than having 1 full time job and possibly being given notice to leave .
example.arg: [more][than having 1 full time job and possibly being given notice to leave]

example.name: secure-j
example.text: He was secure in his masculinity

example.name: secure-j
example.text: The house was secure from break-ins
